1_1FbEENPR12D1yfqWWszQfNgb1Tu5TecMFV.body:
> [bobses](#comment_1_1B2EAgvoxxBcriLxnNXXuJsboE7FbCxtmp): SalutPrimesc o eroare când încerc să rulez ZeroNet cu tor. Am descris-o aici: http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1_1B2EAgvoxxBcriLxnNXXuJsboE7FbCxtmp/Tor+error+TorManager+Tor+addOnion+error+510+Unrecognized+command+ADD+ONION
> Are cineva vreo idee?

Pare o problema similara.
http://tor.stackexchange.com/questions/9352/is-add-onion-control-command-implemented-in-the-latest-stable-release

According to the line 1405 from control-spec.txt, it's present since Tor 0.2.7.1-alpha. Current Tor Browser Bundle (version 5.0.6) use Tor 0.2.7.6, which is a stable one. ADD_ONION should be implemented.

1_1D7uESYtAKV36MVPGJZXuE7LUKbLwfo4dX.body:
In zim-wiki there's a git plugin to track your editing revisions and you could roll-back to a certain time period. The revisions are stored locally in your .git folder and you have pace of mind that your notes are safe.
An owner can delete his site but if a user needs a local backup he could use a similar method to "roll-back" to a previous state.
Or, since zeronet already has the clone feature a "clone and keep in sync" could work. Then the user would have a copy and can publish it later on.
Or, having 2 owners of a site. To be removed there would need to be a consensus. The two or more owners would have to agree by signing with their keys for the site to be removed.
